content.description: Stand start on sloping rail. Campus out right... gain a good hold at the X, make some hard moves on very smooth/slippery crimps up a crack system, and make a sketchy ass topout.
content.location: This is in the lower canyon.

content.description: Stand start on small left crimp and right on bad sidepull.

Set your feet up, maybe with a heel hook. Make a pretty big throw up to a sloping hold. Lock off and move up and around to top out.

Awkward, guaranteed to make you give it a couple of goes before you stick that throw.

Very tricky.

Start on micro crimps and figure out how to pop your left foot up on the rock and set a heel hook - you feel really insecure setting that foot. ifficult, especially if your not flexible. Fom there, make a series of fun moves up and around the lip to the apex of the boulder.

Possible sit start to the route - but very very hard.
content.protection: Need a spotter for sure, and a pad.
content.location: This line is back behind and to the left of Knight Rider abuout 10-15 ft.

content.description: Sit-start on the far left side of the boulder, traverse right until you hit a yellow hole - then go up. Pull into a sidepull crimp (if you can call it that) and throw out to a glossy sloper. Pull with all your might and make it up to the ledge. Be careful from here, polished granite - slippery.
content.protection: Need a pad and a spotter.
content.location:
This boulder is, if your looking at

Knight Rider

, directly to the left about 20 yards.

content.description:
Start in the same area as

Knight Rider

, except go right instead.

Set a heel hook and go far right to a crescent micro crimp. Match and go up from there, using a sloper on your left.

The green route in the pic.

Start on an incut crimp and throw out to a pinch. Set up and throw up to another incut, forgiving crimp/jug. Top out on a fin....

Really fun.
content.location: The Fin Boulder - middle of the canyon.  Crawl up to it, it's hard to see - in kind of a cave.

content.description:
The red route in the pic.

Start on an incut crimp and move out to a pinch. Make a series of gut busting slopers and finally make a fun lock-off move to pull up and out. Top out from here....

Think heel hooks....
content.location: The Fin Boulder - middle of the canyon. Crawl up to it, it's hard to see - in kind of a cave.

content.description:
Start down low in the cave at about 4 feet with your left hand on a sidepull and your right hand on an undercling/sidepull.

It is glossy.
content.protection: Pad, the boulders in the cave.
content.location:
This line is almost directly behind

KITT

.

Come up to a cave and walk into it and go all the way around and you'll hit it.

There is possibly another difficult line on the other side of this boulder, just waiting for an FA.

content.description:
Stand start on a set of crimps and high step up off the ground and onto the route. Then make a series of moves on polished granite up the slab.

Pretty fun.
content.protection: A pad, if that. Good landing.
content.location:
This route is at the bottom of the hill, near

KITT

and

Hasselhoff

.
